file_content.text: We'll be compiling this data for some time, I think.
You've brought me readings? Excellent!
It looks like you were able to conduct many scans. Did the droids pose much of a threat when you encountered them?
Hardly.
Truly? Perhaps we should have left them to mature a bit longer... but we can observe prototypes built from this data.
They were linked to a powerful central figure. I scanned it as well.
No, with one exception.
A hive mind, perhaps? Intriguing. I'll make sure your due diligence is properly rewarded.
They kept me pretty busy.
This situation could have been avoided entirely if command would acknowledge my requests for a security detail.
I worked hard for you.
All I have is what's left of my excavation budget, but you're welcome to every last credit.
You've ensured that Tatooine will hold no secrets from the Empire. Thank you.
I'd attack before the droids get any smarter and decide to fortify that derelict sandcrawler.
Humblest apologies, but I have a request that requires the attention of highly trained combatants.
Oh! My lord, my lord! It's so good you're here.
You there, can you tell your commander--oh, you're with Intelligence. Even better.
You there, I'm drafting you into the Imperial Reclamation Service's... service.
Band of filthy Jawas cracked into one of the Czerka Corporation's abandoned compounds we recently unearthed. Made off with every droid in the place.
And you want the droids back.
The Jawas may have foiled the ideal recovery of these artifacts, but that doesn't mean the Empire can't still benefit from the technology.
A terrible loss.
Luckily, the only real damage done was to the Jawas themselves. Serves them right.
I don't waste my talents tracking down petty thefts.
Hunting Jawas is beneath me.
It's not petty; these excavations produce the only thing of value on this dust bowl. Besides, the Jawas aren't the problem anymore.
You see, the stolen droids activated. Now they're systematically hunting down everything around the Jawas' derelict sandcrawler.
I've observed their behaviors becoming refined, more efficient. Honestly, it looks like they're learning from trial and error.
They sound like standard battle droids acting on their programming.
Seems normal to me.
Battle droids don't self-coordinate. Without someone giving orders, they follow basic self-defense programming.
Really?
If these droids are adaptive and self-coordinating, their applications would be innumerable.
Please, stop boring me.
Fine--the bottom line is the Empire would benefit from acquiring this technology.
Scanning the architecture of the droids' memory cores should give us more insight into their uniform design and their individual differences.
Would you all be willing to help reclaim these lost artifacts?
Can the Reclamation Service count on your support?
Only if I benefit.
I have a budget for the excavation that's completely useless to me now. I don't care where it goes as long as something's recovered.
I'll gladly pay for readings taken with this diagnostic scanner.
I'll handle it.
So long as you're paying.
It's unlikely that the droids will stand idle while you attempt to take a reading. Disabling them will be necessary.
Just try not to damage their memory cores while you're taking the fight out of them.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
Please! I have a situation on my hands. Some other time.
